greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangular array T read by rows: T(h,k) = number of paths consisting of steps from (1,1) to (h,k) such that each step has length 1 directed up or right and each vertex (i,j) satisfies i/2<=j<=2i, for h=0,1,2,... and k=0,1,2,...
link: Alois P. Heinz, Rows n = 0..200, flattened
results.author: _Clark Kimberling_
ext: Offset changed to 0 by _Alois P. Heinz_, Oct 06 2016
